what: The rgeomex provides the polygon data of INEGI 2019 and INE 2020
title: The rgeomex provides the polygon data of INEGI 2019 and INE 2020
text: rgeomex package developed department prevention control diseases transmitted vector Secretary Health Veracruz collaboration CENAPRECE INDRE

title: The rgeomex provides the polygon data of INEGI 2019 and INE 2020
text: rgeomex package provide spatial dataset (areal data) available published homepage INE INEGI. spatial dataset useful visualization spatial analysis diseases. secondary objective package provide spatial bases calculation dengue hotspots vectors. package six spatial datasets. blocks_ine20_mx spatial dataset containing polygon data blocks Mexico (INE 2020). localities_inegi19_mx spatial dataset containing polygon data localities Mexico (INEGI 2019). AGEB_inegi19_mx spatial dataset containing polygon data AGEBs Mexico (INEGI 2019). AGEE_inegi19_mx spatial dataset containing polygon data AGEE Mexico (INEGI 2019). AGEM_inegi19_mx spatial dataset containing polygon data AGEM Mexico (INEGI 2019).

title: The rgeomex provides the polygon data of INEGI 2019 and INE 2020
text: can install released version rgeomex CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: The rgeomex provides the polygon data of INEGI 2019 and INE 2020
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(magrittr) library(sf) #> Warning: package 'sf' was built under R version 4.1.3 #> Linking to GEOS 3.9.1, GDAL 3.2.1, PROJ 7.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE loc_acapulco <-  rgeomex::loc_inegi19_mx %>%     sf::st_make_valid() |>         dplyr::filter(NOMGEO %in% c(similiars::find_most_similar_string("Acapulco de Juarez", unique(NOMGEO))) &                           AMBITO %in% c("Urbana")) plot(sf::st_geometry(loc_acapulco)) y <- rgeomex::AGEB_inegi_2019_a |>     sf::st_make_valid() ageb_acapulco <- y[loc_acapulco,] head(ageb_acapulco) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 9 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -99.95915 ymin: 16.81636 xmax: -99.84201 ymax: 16.89684 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>       OBJECTID        CVEGEO CVE_ENT CVE_MUN CVE_LOC CVE_AGEB Ambito Shape_Leng #> 18715    18715 1200100010405      12     001    0001     0405 Urbana   5259.950 #> 18716    18716 1200100012187      12     001    0001     2187 Urbana   3042.943 #> 18717    18717 1200100010496      12     001    0001     0496 Urbana   5651.284 #> 18718    18718 1200100010513      12     001    0001     0513 Urbana   9803.373 #> 18719    18719 1200100010528      12     001    0001     0528 Urbana   8486.585 #> 18720    18720 1200100012242      12     001    0001     2242 Urbana   2769.117 #>       Shape_Area                       geometry #> 18715  1039839.0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.86266 1... #> 18716   200872.4 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.95219 1... #> 18717  1199501.4 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.91208 1... #> 18718  1447090.3 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.84382 1... #> 18719  1549657.9 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.85683 1... #> 18720   215333.1 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.95224 1... ggplot2::ggplot()+   ggplot2::geom_sf(data = ageb_acapulco,                    fill = "gray80",                    col = "white",                    lwd = 0.1) +   ggplot2::theme_void() +   ggplot2::geom_sf(data = loc_acapulco,                    fill = NA,                    col = "black",                    lwd = .5) blocks_acapulco <- rbind(rgeomex::blocks_ine20_mx_a,                          rgeomex::blocks_ine20_mx_b) |>     sf::st_make_valid()  blocks_acapulco <- blocks_acapulco[loc_acapulco,] head(blocks_acapulco) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 8 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -99.95625 ymin: 16.8926 xmax: -99.95195 ymax: 16.89642 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>          gid id entidad distrito municipio seccion localidad manzana #> 479902 46791  5      12        4         1       1         1      63 #> 479903 46826 59      12        4         1       2         1      69 #> 479904 46792  9      12        4         1       1         1      65 #> 479905 46793  8      12        4         1       1         1      66 #> 479906 46763  2      12        4         1       1         1       1 #> 479907 46778 39      12        4         1       1         1      49 #>                              geometry #> 479902 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.95311 1... #> 479903 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.95251 1... #> 479904 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.95333 1... #> 479905 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.95352 1... #> 479906 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.95456 1... #> 479907 MULTIPOLYGON (((-99.95625 1...  ggplot2::ggplot()+   ggplot2::geom_sf(data = blocks_acapulco,                    fill = "gray80",                    col = "white",                    lwd = 0.1) +   ggplot2::theme_void() +   ggplot2::geom_sf(data = loc_acapulco,                    fill = NA,                    col = "black",                    lwd = .5)

what: Polygons of AGEBs from México of the National Institute of Geography and Statistics 2019 — AGEB_inegi_2019_a
title: Polygons of AGEBs from México of the National Institute of Geography and Statistics 2019 — AGEB_inegi_2019_a
text: spatial dataset containing polygon data AGEBs México

title: Polygons of AGEBs from México of the National Institute of Geography and Statistics 2019 — AGEB_inegi_2019_a
Polygons of AGEBs from México of the National Institute of Geography and Statistics 2019 — AGEB_inegi_2019_a
text: sf object 80202 rows 10 variables: OBJECTID ids. CVEGEO string key. key included CVE_ENT, CVE_MUN, CVE_LOC CVE_AGEB CVE_ENT string key state. CVE_MUN string key Municipality. CVE_LOC string key locality. CVE_AGEB string key AGEB. Ambito binary variable two values, Urbana Rural. dataset inly AGEB Urban Shape_Leng length polygon geometry simple feature.

title: find_most_similar_string — find_most_similar_string
text: Returns vector similar string another vector. Returns vector length input vector '.s'.

title: find_most_similar_string — find_most_similar_string
code: find_most_similar_string(   .s,   .t,   max_dist = Inf,   verbose = TRUE,   ignore_case = TRUE,   feeling_lucky = FALSE,   ... )

title: find_most_similar_string — find_most_similar_string
text: .s character vector matched. .t character vector matched . max_dist maximum string distance verbose warnings printed console. ignore_case case ignored? Default TRUE. feeling_lucky multiple similar strings found. first one returned? ... arguments passed utils::adist.

title: find_most_similar_string — find_most_similar_string
text: character vector
